dialogue.text: Oh? What's this?
Take a wild guess, Ayane.
Did you come all the way over here to propose to me in the middle of the hallway?
Yes. I was brainstorming the most romantic places to do it and I just kept landing on “dorm hallway.”
Wha...Sensei...
Do you really mean that?...
No? Absolutely not. On what planet would that actually be true?
I was kind of hoping it would be Earth...
No, Ayane. But, while I'm not here to propose to you, I am here to hang out.
So I suggest you stop pounding on your door for a second and, I don't know, pay more attention to me or something.
Sensei, you know there's no one in the world I'd rather pay attention to than you. But I promised Sana I'd wake her up around this time and it's already like, ten minutes after the time she gave me.
Why not just go inside? It's your room, isn't it?
It is. But I think that in an effort to sleep longer, Sana's subconscious may have forced her out of bed to lock the deadbolt on the door and now I can't get in.
Which, of course, means that I must repeatedly knock until my mission is complete.
Ayane, you know I have a key that controls both locks on the door, right? I can let you in if-
I'm sorry, Makoto. But this is something I must handle on my own.
Uh...I guess if that's what you think is best...
Oh! I know! After Sana wakes up, what if all three of us did something together?
Something like what, exactly? Because I was kind of hoping to be alone with you.
Oh?
I mean, that's not how I meant it. But I enjoy that face, so you are free to interpret it that way and act in accordance to whatever you believe I want.
Oh, I know what you want.
I am still right here-
Can it, Makoto. This is a moment between me, Sensei, and possibly Sana if we can get her to wake up.
I'm sorry, what was that last part?
It's her room as well, Sensei. We can try to ignore her if we want, but chances are she's going to notice once things really start to get going.
Maybe I should be the one to knock instead? I'm stronger.
Sensei! You're underestimating just how much Sana loves street corn!
I swear, sometimes it's like you don't even remember your place in this video game.
Sorry, Ayane.
Really? Then I can keep you all to myself and it will be completely justified?!
Wait, what? Did I just miss a line of dialogue or something?
Alas...reduced from future wife to mere acquaintance in one, brief conversation.
Stop assigning yourself roles you never earned.
Anyway, I’m glad you dropped by, Sensei. I just wish it was under more fun circumstances and that I could actually get inside of my room.
I was kind of busy anyway.
With the street corn?
No. Something else.
What?
All I can tell you is that it’s supposed to bring the dead back to life.
What?
What?
{i}What?{/i}
{i}Ayane’s affection has increased to [ayane_love]!{/i}
